intro: Pterocephalus adenophorus, commonly known as the Chinese iron vine, is a flowering plant native to China and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Leguminosae (Fabaceae) and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in racemes, followed by pod-like fruits containing several seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine. The species is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it resilient to drought conditions.
